alert.note: Alert for Livingston; Macomb; Oakland (Michigan) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued November 18 at 10:09AM EST by NWS Detroit
info.description: ...CAUTIOUS TRAVEL IS ADVISED FOR RAPID REDUCTIONS OF VISIBILITIES AND BRIEF SNOW SQUALLS TODAY... WEATHER... * Scattered snow squalls will impact the northern Metro Detroit suburbs, including the I-96, I-696, and M-59 corridors, during the late morning and early afternoon. * A dusting of snow can be expected between 10AM and 1PM. Areas that see briefly heavier bursts of snow will see quick accumulations up to a half inch. IMPACTS... * Moderate to briefly heavy snow will cause reductions of visibility to less than one mile at times. There may be rapid fluctuations of visibility. * Accumulating snow may lead to slippery roads particularly on bridges, exit ramps and overpasses. && PRECAUTIONARY/PREPAREDNESS ACTIONS... * The combination of moderate to heavy snow and gusty winds will result in localized white out conditions. Reduced visibilities along with snow covered and slippery roads will cause variable traffic rates throughout the area. Motorists are urged to use caution and account for the variable driving conditions by allowing extra time. * Prepare, plan and stay informed. Visit http://go.usa.gov/c7kkP
